messageBody:
On Friday 24 September 2004 10:25, Harald Mueller wrote:
> > There are 5 messages in this issue.
> >
> > Topics in this digest:
> >
> > Hi everybody,
> >
> > my question concerns a different approach of writing tests. I'm in the
> > unfortunate situation of having to write tests for an existing
> > application(I haven't been involved in the development). Â´
>
> Unfortunate? This is the standard situation in most processes: Test are
> written after development or in parallel to it. What's so unfortunate about
> writing tests?

It's not the test-writing that's unfortunate. It's writing the tests
post-hoc.

In XP, (programmer aka unit) tests are (dynamically) written *first*,
as part of the design-and-develop activity; this is referred to as
"test-driven development", often written TDD.
